sentences.en: He clearly found the physical exertion exhilarating.
sentences.cn: 他明显感觉体力劳动令人愉快。

sentences.en: I can't really describe it, but it's a very exhilarating tune!
sentences.cn: 我没办法形容, 但是这是个非常令人快活的曲调!

sentences.en: In fact, a light rain made it all the more exhilarating.
sentences.cn: 事实上, 一场小雨会更加增添其中的情趣.

sentences.en: It could be exhilarating, intimidating, sometimes even discouraging, but always challenging.
sentences.cn: 哈佛的生活使人兴奋, 让人胆怯, 有时甚至会感到泄气, 但永远充满了挑战.

sentences.en: It was a busy, exhilarating scene and yet, I know not why, restful to the spirit.
sentences.cn: 这是一种令人振奋的繁忙景象,然而, 不知道为什么, 又令人心旷神怡.

sentences.en: It was a silence and a sheer whiteness exhilarating to madress.
sentences.cn: 皑皑白雪,一望无际,四处静悄悄的一片,叫人欣喜若狂.

sentences.en: It was exhilarating to be on the road again and his spirits rose.
sentences.cn: 重新踏上旅途令他非常振奋，兴致高涨。

sentences.en: It's not exhilarating, it's not brave, and it's rather dull, but it's eminently safe.
sentences.cn: 这并不鼓舞人心, 也不是勇敢, 倒 是挺沉闷; 但这十分安全可靠.

sentences.en: The effect on Tollifer of this amazing interview was extrmely exhilarating.
sentences.cn: 这次意外的会晤使都力弗感到极端兴奋.

sentences.en: The exhilarating ripple of her voice was a wild tonic in the rain.
sentences.cn: 她那悠扬的嗓音在雨中听了使人陶醉.

sentences.en: The sheer exuberance of the sculpture was exhilarating.
sentences.cn: 那尊雕塑表现出的勃勃生机让人振奋。

sentences.en: There are people from time to time and exhilarating bursts of fragrance.
sentences.cn: 不时还有阵阵清香让人神清气爽.

sentences.en: We have just got some exhilarating news.
sentences.cn: 我们刚得到一些令人振奋的消息.

sentences.en: Yet the rate of change, though exhilarating, was disturbing.
sentences.cn: 然而变化太快了, 固然令人兴奋, 也使人不安.

words.tran_cn: 使振奋；使高兴（exhilarate的过去式和过去分词）
使人愉快的；令人喜欢的；爽快的
使高兴，使兴奋（exhilarate的现在分词形式）

trans.tran_cn: 使人高兴的，令人兴奋的，振奋的
trans.tran_en: making you feel happy, excited, and full of energy

trans.tran_cn: 使高兴，使兴奋( exhilarate的现在分词)
